cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwestward, expected to cross the Yucatan Peninsula Tuesday night, enter the south-central Gulf of Mexico Wednesday, then curve north-northwest toward the Louisiana Gulf Coast late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between Morgan City and Cameron)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory 5A
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory 5A
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Alabama and Mississippi, with highest risk along Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) possible late Friday into early Saturday; a low (but increasing) chance of 50-kt gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 3–5 ft possible along lower Mississippi River; some backwater effects may propagate upriver toward Baton Rouge
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible, leading to flash flooding and elevated river stages
weather_observation.other_hazards: River flooding and debris flow could disrupt terminal and landside access roads
